job_title: Assistant Dean of Admissions in Northfield, MN
pros: Community, Supportive Teams, Close-Knit Collaborative Work
cons: Pay vs. similar institutions is less competitive

pros: St. Olaf College has a beautiful campus! The students are great!
cons: Finding your place at St. Olaf is a challenge. It feels like a microcosm of the small town in which it is set: people are really nice on the surface, but it's clear you are an outsider unless you kowtow to everything the higher ups say. It is such a white environment, steeped with so many, very comfortable, white administrators.

pros: -The opportunity to meet people from different backgrounds
cons: -The payment rate could he higher

job_title: Sports Information Assistant in Northfield, MN
pros: As a student employee, working as a sports information assistant was a great opportunity to get experience doing camerawork for sporting events in an atmosphere that is low stress and encourages creativity in the shots you get
cons: Low pay, but where are you gonna find better pay on campus to be fair

pros: Great community to work in
cons: The pay only just increased

review_title: The best job I've ever had
pros: This is such a great team who are amazing at what they do and have fun while doing it.
cons: There aren't any cons to this job.

pros: Flexible, great people, fun environment

pros: Nice colleagues, great building, free lunch at faculty meetings, conference support up to $2000 per year.
cons: Do not value their professors very much, more and more adjuncts, do not give tenure-track positions, keep you on a 1-year contract.

pros: Community, students, colleagues, meaningful work

review_title: Liberal Arts College with Work Life Balance
pros: Work Life Balance is valued. Northfield is good to have raised a family in. Higher ed institution that is value based and IT is treated as respected part of community.
cons: Smaller school. Salaries often lower than market. Benefits sometimes less competitive than at larger schools. Retirement and other benefits better. Compare whole compensation letter, not just salary.

review_title: Nothing but great things to say!
pros: Easy to balance with coursework
cons: Nothing that I can think of.

pros: Work closely with medical professionals.
cons: None, COVID created some challenges.

pros: happy fun connected strong proud
cons: really no cons at all

pros: It is a great place to work

pros: We have a great community and a great working team. The support of other staff members is great.
cons: I think the pay is a little low compared to similar other institutions.

job_title: Head of Strategy for Library Collections & Archives in Northfield, MN
pros:
always opportunities to learn
great bosses
cons: health insurance provided is self-insured

review_title: Hope you get a good supervisor
pros:
- Single room
- Resources to help other students
- Get to know other students
- Student staff is tight-knit
- Reliable, consistent schedule
cons:
- Incredibly low pay, note that room is not included in stipend
- No work/life balance; you live where you work and you are never not working
- If you have a good supervisor, your year won't be made worse. If you have a bad supervisor (incompetent, doesn't listen, doesn't care, avoids responsibility, etc.), there's nothing you can do to resist them.
- Low level of antagonism from residents
- Little choice about what hall you will be placed in. This means a great deal of variability in the number of nights for which you are on duty
- Small budget ($100, $120, $125 for the whole year) for running events for residents

review_title: Great place to work...while you're there
pros: Student workers will find competitive pay and have plenty of opportunity to work in a field related to their skills and interests, with low stress and pressure. St. Olaf has the best food in the world, great benefits and atmosphere. Emphasis on community. Plenty of opportunities for employment with the college after graduation, lacking other options (Art majors....)
cons: Upon graduation your degree means little outside of the Twin Cities area, so you may HAVE to take a job at St. Olaf. While it's a good place to start your career and you will receive strong recommendations, the pay is not great.

job_title: Intern Data Analyst in Wausau, WI
pros: I really enjoyed the supportive environment; the Academic Support Center does all that they can to equip you and lets you teach the material with which you are most comfortable.
cons: I had a hard time with time management while in this position. The management assume that students have more time than they actually do, so try to be more flexible regarding student schedules.

pros:
- Many hours available (24 hr)
- Many worker so taking small to large shifts is available
- Exchange of shifts easily done and effective
- Not too busy and give you time to do other work (Homework, etc)
- Laid back most of the time
cons:
- Can be hectic
- Can be stuck assigned to late hours (graveyard shifts)
- Request for shift exchange is completely based on if anyone takes or wants your shift
- no absence allowed
- no tolerance with absence, fired immediately if absent or late to shift

job_title: Student Library Assistant in Northfield, MN
pros: It helps pays your tuition. The library staff are wonderful.
cons: I really felt that I could have had a better education elsewhere. If you're a student here, this is a fine job, but I don't recommend St. Olaf as a college. I highly don't recommend if you're a person of color or a woman, because racism and sexual assault are rampant.

pros: Salary is reasonable, some excellent colleagues, some truly bright and engaging students, a teaching load that is "good" for liberal arts colleges
cons: An ethos of coddling certain students; location; lack of student. faculty, and staff diversity; lack of scholarly resources outside of the sciences; an exceptionalist narrative that celebrates parochialism; nepotism (comparatively high percentage of alumni on faculty)

pros: Very motivated and hard working students. Excellent facilities. Nice environment. Good food.
cons:
Good luck finding housing. Nobody is responsible or very interested in helping temporary faculty find housing, I spent 4 months in a hotel without my family.
Teachers working fulltime during the summer are not eligible for benefits.

pros: There are a few truly wonderful and gracious people at the College. If you happen to associate with any of them, you may find your time at the College edifying.
cons: The institutional culture is duplicitous unless one gives their total allegiance to the status quo. Diversity, progress, and innovation are terms used to obfuscate the truly parochial point of view. Ironically, they will eventually be confronted with the repercussions of such a way of being.

pros:
Wonderful faculty and staff
Awesome environment to be around - brilliant minds and an open atmosphere
cons:
Not the best pay or benefits and my experience was somewhat vague about what lay in the future.
The student body seems to be allowed to start campaigns for the most mundane of issues. Somewhat sad to see a lackluster social environment and overlooking of larger issues.

review_title: A great learning experience with lots of support and flexibility.
pros: As a student its super flexible with scheduling and you get to do lots of cool things and have unique opportunities that come with working for a college. Lots of great staff to work with and talk too. Approachable management. Easy to talk with any issues one might be having.
cons: Sometimes the work can get a little boring or monotonous.

job_title: Sociology & Anthropology Student Office Worker in Northfield, MN
pros: Lots of flexibility in your schedule, you are able to choose (somewhat) the projects you work on, faculty are open to ideas on new department events and projects.
cons: While faculty are open to new ideas, making them happen will be an uphill battle. Unclear expectations regarding certain tasks. Sometimes confusion from having multiple members of faculty assign you work at the same time.

job_title: Human Resources Student Worker in Northfield, MN
pros: As a student worker, there are plenty of jobs in different areas to explore options/passions and gain some great working experience.  I've worked in the Lion's Pause, Tutor, TA, and in the HR department, and they've all been good experiences.
cons: For some jobs (Lions Pause Kitchen) the hours can be rough, but in the case of the Pause, your coworkers and the atmosphere make up for it.

pros: Nice environment and friendly coworkers
cons: Not a lot of room for advancement.  Cost of benefits keep increasing.  Wage increases not even close to the rate of inflation.  "That's how it is in Higher Education" is a common phrase.

review_title: Overall, an amazing and wonderfully enriching experience, about which I cannot say enough positive things.
pros: Awesome colleagues, interesting work, and I felt like I was an important part of something bigger than myself. (Bigger than myself and worthwhile.)
cons: Not having enough time to do all the things you want to do; sometimes work was sporadic...it depended on the season.

job_title: Intramural Sports Supervisor in Minneapolis, MN
pros: Great environment to work at. The people are always open and friendly, the college culture enhances this even further.
cons: Really, there is no con to working at St. Olaf. The college really works hard to make sure all its employees have the environment they need to be at their best.

pros: Colleagues, Workplace environment, Retirement & health benefits, Free classes
cons: Low salary, Few opportunities for promotion, Lack of meaninful communication between staff and upper management

pros:
Some of the best students in the nation, caring faculty, and hardworking staff.
Beautiful campus in one of the best college towns in America.
cons:
Staff is grossly underpaid.
Leadership leaves a lot to be desired.
Poor managerial practices - an overall culture of fear.

pros:
Piper center is probably the best career center I've seen
Music programs are excellent
Sports teams are great to be on
Best professors in the world
cons: President seems to care way more about the bottom line than his students.  Handled the baseball hazing incident incompetently.

pros: Worked with some of the best in the industry. Passionate and fun people the spend each day with.
cons: Less micro-managing. Many hours outside of the regular 9-5.

job_title: Newsletter Editor/Office Assistant in Decatur, GA
pros: Great for income if you're an actual student. Great people to work with. Many departments are very flexible with your schedule.
cons: Only that you get paid once a month as a student. At least bi-monthly would be better.

pros: If you're surrounded by a good group of people, it can be a great place to work.
cons: However, some of the higher-level management is really out of touch, especially with regards to the student sexual assault policies.

pros:
- Can interact with other people
- The job description is pretty clear
- You'll have opportunity to work more hours/summer hours
cons: - I don't really have any cons, I enjoyed my time working here.

pros: Beautiful place to work. Low stress. Access to world class gym. You can take one class a semester.
cons: Low wages. They do not promote from within. Employer doesn't follow it's own mission statement.

job_title: Director, Art Museum in Northfield, MN
pros: Invigorating intellectual environment, supportive supervisor, flexible schedule with autonomy
cons: Position is extremely demanding but only 0.75 FTE. Business outlook unknown; College approaching significant budget cuts.

review_title: A great place to work, but limited opportunities for advancement in staff roles.
pros: Culture of learning and the students are intelligent and youthful.
cons: Limited opportunities for advancement in staff roles.

pros: Easy to manage with courses. This was a positive experience.
cons: Advancement isn't an option.

pros: Great community atmosphere and people are great to work with.
cons: Pay is on the low end in comparison to jobs that are similar in the Twin Cities.

review_title: One of professional and personal growth.
pros: The atmosphere is idyllic and the work is meaningful.
cons: The winters are quite cold.

pros: Very flexible and reasonable pay for a student.
cons: Depending on the campus job, not enough hours are given to students.

pros: Flexible Hours, Good Supervising, Some research, learn great business related stuff
cons: the work can get a little monotonous

review_title: Great school and pretty good job.
